Just a ????? question
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Just a ????? question
By Foster on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 12:25 pm:

Has anyone run across any rares?? I mean the equivalent of the ??? monsters?

Just wondering, because there has been that trend with the other two games, and I didnt know if tecmo has announced what those discs might be, if there are any.
How did we all find out about the other games' rares??

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 12:45 pm:

We found out about the MR1 &2 rares by finding them in our collections. (I was, I believe, the first person to discover the Dominoes, Monol/???, on No One Can Stop Mr. Domino, in the third week of September 1999) Since the monster cards in this game cannot be obtained from CD, we'll have to wait and see if someone earns a rare in a game. Overall, there are a limited number of possible cards because the book only has so many spaces in it. And there are no locked CDs in this game.

By Foster on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 04:00 pm:

is there a information site or anything that actually posts what the creators intended???

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 05:41 pm:

Tecmo has always been really uninformative, that's why there's so much activity on the web regarding these games. Occasionally, they have given select mgazines some info, but it's usually months after the games' release. Anyway, this game just doesn't have that many monster cards, there's just not the room in the book.

By Trickster on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 06:45 pm:

Since there IS a limited number of spaces in the book, and so forth, the only real equivalent I could think of for the rare monsters in this game would be if certain rare cd's gave you the mixed breed monsters. But I doubt that's the case.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 08:10 pm:

We've managed to get over 700 CDs up in the list so far, and no one has reported finding a monster card. I just don't think it's going to happen!

By Trickster on Sunday, August 6, 2000 - 08:47 pm:

Yeah, neither did I. ;) But then again, if they're like the "rare" cards in Monster Rancher 1/2, how often do *those* pop up?

Just playing devil's advocate >:]
